Articles.Content: That looks amazing! I too got that book, love the concept art. Will you also be updating the model for the lander?
honestly, I think u should get rid of some of the surface details on the docking tubes
the only flaw I see is that the surface textures of the docking area modules are actually more like those of Tranquility Node on the ISS. However, the shape and dimensions are right.

http://i.imgur.com/P6tnAqd.png

The endurance looks great benjee!

http://i.imgur.com/P6tnAqd.png

well, that IVA isn't too bad itself!

EDIT: This picture(http://i.imgur.com/TCoACFr.jpg) should provide a better reference for the docking area.

EDIT2: also this: http://i.imgur.com/0uWg712.png

Edited December 27, 2014 by billbobjebkirk
Docking area:

I might be "late" for this, but I don't know if you know that in the "Board the Endurance" webpage (the webpage with the 3D model of Endurance) there is an interior mode for the Ranger. You can look around inside, go through it, and sit in the seat. I think this might help with the IVA, but you might have already known about this.

Ugh, you think you are the first to point that out? Please look through the thread first before suggesting something repeatedly!

There's lots of pages to search through, it's understandable. People are just trying to help.

Updated the docking hub:

Edited December 27, 2014 by benjee10

that looks really nice

Ugh, you think you are the first to point that out? Please look through the thread first before suggesting something repeatedly!

@SpaceXray: It's no big deal. I had actually forgotten about that until I read his post. Helped me with the latest revision of the IVA. I'd perfer people that are eager to help rather than people who are worried constantly about reposting something. Also, who is Dan, and why are we freeing him?

@benjee: What angle are those docking ports at? The one on the ranger is 25 degrees from horizontal, and then I think they're tilted inward towards each other a little bit as well.

Edited December 27, 2014 by Shryq

@SpaceXray: It's no big deal. I had actually forgotten about that until I read his post. Helped me with the latest revision of the IVA. I'd perfer people that are eager to help rather than people who are worried constantly about reposting something. Also, who is Dan, and why are we freeing him?

@benjee: What angle are those docking ports at? The one on the ranger is 25 degrees from horizontal, and then I think they're tilted inward towards each other a little bit as well.

Yeah, the thread has grown a lot. This is probably my most anticipated mod! iDan122 is a guy who was banned months ago and people made numerous petitions like this hashtag for example, but with no luck.

I wonder why why in the movie they turn the seats and command panels 90Ã‚Â° up in orbit, is it to get a better view through the top windows? But the Ranger docks backwards so there is almost no point!

By the way, will the Endurance have 4 docking nodes on the ring connections just like the original?

By the way, will the Endurance have 4 docking nodes on the ring connections just like the original?

Adding docking ports is incredibly easy. If they're there in the movie, we can probably add them, but I guess that's technically up to benjee.
O.. M.. G.. Everyone get out of the way because the "Interstellar-in-KSP Hype Train" cannot be stopped!! *honk* *honk*
benjee can i fix some of the modeling on the lander?

Feel free! I was planning to do a complete remodel myself but I probably won't have time, so go ahead!

And yeah, I have the 4 docking ports in place around the ring. And I need to fix the angle on the Ranger adapters.

If they're there in the movie, we can probably add them, but I guess that's technically up to benjee.

I'm pretty sure that

attempted to use one of them.

I'm pretty sure that
attempted to use one of them.

I think that's the first time I've ever seen the Spoiler feature used for what it was made for XD

this looks like the rocket that sent the ranger to space

Clearly a Saturn V
How did they send the Endurance into orbit anyways? Was it launched in one piece or separate modules?

How did they send the Endurance into orbit anyways? Was it launched in one piece or separate modules?

I think it's put together from different modules similar to the ISS

I've remade the windows on the lander, didn't touch the engines. I'm not really sure how to make the RCS ports, I'll leave that and texturing to you benjee

I'll work on the IVA now~

https://www.dropbox.com/s/838um3hv5778w7t/HMlander.blend?dl=0

Edited December 30, 2014 by xxhansonmaxx
That model is amazing.

I've remade the windows on the lander, didn't touch the engines. I'm not really sure how to make the RCS ports, I'll leave that and texturing to you benjee

I'll work on the IVA now~

https://www.dropbox.com/s/838um3hv5778w7t/HMlander.blend?dl=0

http://i.imgur.com/vmecWRZ.png

RCS ports are probably best to be done all through texturing with clever diff and nrm alignment, then, later go in and assign RCS ports over those spots in (unity I think, this is where my modding knowledge stops XD)

EDIT: Also, I just read that about half of the shots in the movie with the interstellar used a real scale model

So if anybody has money and connections to Christopher Nolan try to get BenJee access to this XD
